pr_title: GH-2143 ensure project is binary compatible with 3.1 releases

timeline.message: GH-2143 added old method signatures for binary compatility

GH-2143 fixed (binary) backward compatibity issues

- using temporary default methods as a stop-gap measure to ensure
  existing code will continue to run and compile
- using `@implNote` and `@apiNote` javadoc tags to document expectations
GH-2143 configure japicmp plugin to check binary/source compatibility

timeline.bodyText: This is one of the many reasons why I want stop using protected as a modifier, as much as possible. I realize we've previously said that we don't really consider protected methods part of the public API, but the fact of the matter is that they're there, and accessible to subclass implementors, and in some cases we even expect subclass implementors to override our protected methods.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra
